body:
hello floecksche,

can you do following test:
- we need a plain fresh oc instance (fresh setup, empty database)
- enable mysql to log sql statements and monitor the logfile (tail -f /........./mysql.log)
  (expecting you use mysql)
- mount sftp
- start a timer (a watch is enough...)
- click in files on the mounted drive (=folder) one time and monitor sql hash creation statements
- whatever szenario, stay in files, donâ´t click around!

szenario 1:
- does this error come up when you go into the subfolder structure <during> hashing

szenario 2:
- prepare oc as above
- does this error come up when you go into the subfolder structure <after finishing> hashing
- document the time taken for finishing hashing and the wire speed for sftp access

i have the feeling that it is maybe related to #2560 but i may be wrong

yes, i use mysql. the problem is that i don't have access to the logile on the machine where i ran into this. so i'lm going to try two things:

1) see what happens when i switch over from mysql to sqlite on that machine
2) try to reproduce this on a different machine where i can access the logfile. just have to install mysql first :(

just tried it on a different machine with access to the mysql logs:

scenario 1) 

yes, i was able to go two folders deep. got the error on the next level. don't have an exact time measurement. 

scenario 2) 

i just clicked on the file app, without opening the external folder or going deeper into the folder structure. the mysql log produced output for exactly 7:30 min, then it stopped. from what i can see, it did not even finish to cache the first folder of the external storage, which already contains a big number of files. it did not cache the rest of the folders. then i tried to open the external folder, it lists the first folder that it started caching for. all the other folders are just shown as text files.

let me know if i can provide more infos.

thanks,

can you tell what the sftp transfer performance resp. cpu/memory load of your webserver during hashing is?

martin

sent from my iphone, please excuse any typos.

am 28.03.2013 um 23:58 schrieb floecksche <notifications@github.com>:

> just tried it on a different machine with access to the mysql logs:
> 
> scenario 1)
> 
> yes, i was able to go two folders deep. got the error on the next level. don't have an exact time measurement.
> 
> scenario 2)
> 
> i just clicked on the file app, without opening the external folder or going deeper into the folder structure. the mysql log produced output for exactly 7:30 min, then it stopped. from what i can see, it did not even finish to cache the first folder, which already contains a big number of files. it did not cache the rest of the folder. then i tried to open the external folder, it lists the first folder that it started caching for. all the other folders are just shown as text files.
> 
> let me know if i can provide more infos.
> 
> â€”
> reply to this email directly or view it on github.

sorry, did not have the chance to check that because of the easter holidays. 

regarding the transfer performance: don't know how to measure that. i assume that it's quite good as both, the machine with the external storage and the machine with owncloud are in my lan.

i'll check the cpu and memory load of the webserver in the evening.

did not manage to try it earlier. just checked the cpu load and memory usage of the apache webserver. cpu load is between 5 and 30% and memory usage below 1 %. the load average of my system is around 0.2.

iâ€™m closing this issue because it has been inactive for a few months. this probably means that the issue is not reproducible or it has been fixed in a newer version.

please reopen if you still encounter this issue with the [latest stable version](http://owncloud.org/install/) (currently owncloud 5.0.9) and then please use the [issue template](https://raw.github.com/owncloud/core/master/issue_template.md). you an also contribute directly by providing a patch â€“ see the [developer manual](http://doc.owncloud.org/server/5.0/developer_manual/). :)

thank you!
